creditline: Gift of Sheila and John Morgan
description: painting of a seated woman in a red hat with a cane; generally green and red pallette
signed:
Signed

LR corner, in black: [AJ Fournier]
text: Portraits by Fournier are quite rare, since he preferred to paint landscapes. The setting for this one is his Minneapolis art studio. It was likely painted between his frequent trips to France in the years 1895 to 1898.
title: The Visitor
